title: Massachusetts emergency room wait times rank among the longest in the U.S.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Massachusetts ranks third in the U.S. for longest emergency room wait times, with an average of 189 minutes.
ER wait times have worsened due to capacity issues and staffing shortages, particularly affecting larger hospitals in Boston.
Behavioral health visits make up 39% of ER cases in 2024, contributing to increased wait times and system strain.

title: Report: Retired 5x Pro Bowl left-tackle offers to help train Will Campbell
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Terron Armstead, a retired 5-time Pro Bowl left tackle, offered to train Patriots' Will Campbell in Dallas this summer.
Campbell's Super Bowl performance drew criticism for his technique; Armstead identified fixable power and timing issues.
Former offensive linemen suggest Campbell review Armstead's tape and adopt a more aggressive playing style.

title: More than 400 readers voted: $240K in-office Boston job or $120K remote?
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: 56% of over 400 readers polled prefer a $240,000 in-person job in Boston over a $120,000 remote job.
40% chose the $120,000 remote job for flexibility, with parents and commuters citing time and cost savings.
4% preferred neither job option, with many favoring a hybrid work model instead.

title: City councilor calls for restrictions on e-bikes and mopeds, including ban for food delivery drivers
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: City Councilor Ed Flynn proposed restrictions on e-bikes, including a ban for delivery drivers using them in Boston.
The proposed measures include registration and license requirements for high-speed e-bike riders and fines for violations.
Flynn's ordinance to ban delivery drivers from using e-bikes was supported by seven councilors, a change from last year's pushback.

title: Video shows corrections officers brawling in elevator at Boston jail
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A brawl broke out among three female corrections officers in an elevator at Suffolk County House of Correction.
The incident, caught on video at 7:30 a.m., involved coffee being knocked and a subsequent physical altercation.
The Suffolk County Sheriff’s Department is investigating the incident and promises appropriate disciplinary action.

title: Asparagus could soon become Massachusetts’ official state vegetable
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Massachusetts lawmakers proposed asparagus as the state vegetable, highlighting its historical significance in Western Massachusetts.
State Rep. Homar Gomez and Sen. Jo Comerford filed the bill, driven by local advocacy from Hadley Elementary students.
Hadley was once known as the 'asparagus capital of the world', although crop production has significantly declined due to fungus.

title: Paula Cole wants to spend Valentine’s Day with you
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Paula Cole will perform a Valentine's Day concert at Groton Hill Music Center in Groton, Massachusetts.
Cole announced a new tour, 'This Fire: 30', starting in September, celebrating the album's 30th anniversary.
She plans to release a 64-track archival box set, 'Sonic Memoir', including unreleased tracks from her Berklee days.

title: Boston meteorologists say Monday’s storm is ‘trending toward a miss’
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists report Monday's storm is likely to miss Boston due to a south-eastern offshore track.
Despite trending south, local meteorologists continue to monitor the storm for potential impacts.
Dry and seasonable weather with some flurries expected in Boston leading up to the holiday weekend.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 12, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Citrus & Salt is opening a second location in Burlington, featuring an expansive patio and private dining areas, in summer 2026.
The Xenia Hospitality Group's new 15-seat omakase spot, Moro Mou, will blend Greek and Japanese cuisines in Seaport by summer 2026.
The Down Low in Woburn offers a Boston-level cocktail bar experience with live entertainment and Detroit-style pizza, open since January 2026.

title: Nikola Vucevic, Celtics roll into All-Star break with blowout win over Bulls: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Nikola Vucevic scored 19 points and secured 11 rebounds, aiding the Celtics' 124-105 victory over the Chicago Bulls.
Payton Pritchard contributed significantly with 26 points, playing a key role in maintaining the Celtics' performance.
Anfernee Simons expressed openness to returning to the Celtics, praising Vucevic and indicating good relations with the team.
